description: Senate Republicans confirmed four dozen of President Trump’s nominees on Thursday, the first tranche of his stalled choices to get over the finish line after the GOP changed the chamber’s rules last week to break a months-long blockade put up by the Democrats.  After weeks of warnings, Republicans late last week pulled the trigger on...

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The House on Thursday approved a Republican bill that seeks to deprioritize some renewable energy from getting onto the electric grid amid broader GOP attacks on green energy. The legislation, which passed 216-206, allows “dispatchable” energy to be prioritized amid the long line of projects that seek to get plugged into the nation’s electric grid....

description: Democracy has long been viewed as humanity’s crowning political achievement. It is hailed as a system that enshrines human rights, ensures peaceful transfers of power, and gives voice to the masses. If AI can prepare a balance sheet, price assets, and develop personnel plans more efficiently than twenty-something degree holders, it’s natural to worry whether demand for those degrees will persist. Recent labor-market developments seem to bear this out. Tasks...

description: Miraculously, against all odds, Russian President Vladimir Putin is winning World War Three — just not on the bloody battlefields of Ukraine. In Ukraine, his battered military — after three-and-a-half years of his Special Military Operation and nearly 1.1 million casualties — remains mired in static trench warfare like World War One. Scott Perry (R-Pa.), was a key source of knowledge for Republicans who pushed hard to roll back green energy tax incentives as part of the “One Big Beautiful Bill” of President Trump’s legislative priorities — particularly those in the House Freedom Caucus. description: Over 120 liberal nonprofit groups pushed back against the expected crackdown by President Trump’s administration after the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, saying that philanthropy “exists to bring people together, not drive them apart.” In the joint letter, signed by 136 organizations, they condemned political violence and any potential retaliation directed their way.   “Organizations...

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: President Trump on Wednesday celebrated ABC's move to pull comedian Jimmy Kimmel off the air indefinitely over his comments about the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Calling the decision "Great News for America," Trump announced on his Truth Social platform, "The ratings challenged Jimmy Kimmel Show is CANCELLED." "Congratulations to ABC for finally having...
title: Trump celebrates ABC pulling Jimmy Kimmel off the air

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democrats on Wednesday evening unveiled an ambitious proposal to fund the government past Sept. 30 that would restore the nearly $1 trillion in cuts to Medicaid made by President Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act, which could cause scores of rural and smaller hospitals around the country to close. The 68-page proposal would also...
title: Democrats want government funding stopgap to reverse nearly $1 trillion in Medicaid cuts
